B3SKu3XK-uokIGc0dHFRZg.text: Loved our dinner here for restaurant week! The pretzel brioche was amazing and I'll definitely be back to eat that again! It came with 3 specialty butters including honey butter, a Dijon butter, and a Cheer Wine butter. They were all fantastic. I had the fettuccine for my meal and it was so filling and the shrimp in it were large and fresh. For dessert I had the donut holes and our server was not kidding when he said they were heavy! I could only finish about 2 after the rest of the meal. Our server was wonderful too; very attentive and had great suggestions.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZId04b0ZwW_xbCWu9qWJ_g.text: I visited Stoke for Charlotte restaurant week 2019. They were booked with reservations the first Friday night but we were told that the bar area is first come first serve but full menu. I arrived and wasn't sure where to enter. I saw a door with stoke on it, went through the second door and found myself in the bar area without a host stand. I stood there for quite some time looking at the bartenders before a server directed me around a corner to the host stand.  She showed me where the open bar seating was. The area has a really nice vibe with low lighting. Our service was quite slow but I assume this is because of the bar seating. It's quite confusing though since the bar area seemed to be almost the same size as the restaurant seating, so why not have proper service everywhere?  If you're unfamiliar with Restaurant week, it's $35 for a 3-4 course meal. You have a variety of options for each course. So, with that said, I ate with two others and we all ordered different appetizers, entrees and desserts. We tried the deviled eggs, pretzel bread, and cheese plate. This was definitely the best part of the meal. The eggs were very tasty and the pretzel bread was soft and came with three kinds of sauces. The bread itself was lightly sweet and amazing. The cheese plate was pretty bare and had a couple of slices of cheese, honey drizzled so lightly we couldn't actually use it, and less than a handful of nuts and fruits. For the entree we had the lamb, shrimp and grits, and the pork. The lamb was recommended but was our least favorite. It was fine, but nothing special. It was also a very small portion. The shrimp and grits were quite tasty and a good size portion. The pork can I top of rice with some very thinly sliced pickles and crunchy flavoring on top. This dish was tasty but not something I would go back for. Lastly we ordered dessert. We had a s'mores sandwich, a brownie, and doughnut holes with heath bar. The smores sandwich tasted like a raisin cookie and was difficult to eat. The middle part oozed out and we never really got to taste it as it became pure liquid. The doughnut holes were your run of the mill doughnuts and on top of a whip cream bed with heath bar. We did not finish this or the s'mores sandwich. We also had the brownie which was quite tasty but only enough for 4 bites.  We also tried a cocktail which was amazing! It was something along the lines of blackberry bramble. I would go back strictly for this drink!  Overall, it was not at all worth the $35(+cocktail). It was a fairly average meal at an upscale location.  Definitely take an Uber here as parking is hard to find uptown

XODX9yHKS6koQniPPozbRg.text: Friendly bartender! We arrive 30 minutes before the kitchen closed and they sat us in the bar and let us order from the regular menu. Highlights of the meal included the cocktails, a pea salad and their s'mores dessert. Worth a visit

3F_UO5-Tj4KCfSnWvJkxAQ.text: Loved it!!! A great dining experience. Food and service, by Molly, were top notch. Unfortunately, yelp pictures aren't too helpful since the menu changes every couple of months.   Our group sat next to the kitchen. It was calm and clean.   The gigantic doughnut is a menu staple for a reason and you won't regret it. I could do without the crushed Heath bar garnish.

sc6Lmn8nX2v9my0-GSBOkA.text: Yikes, this place was not good. We went for restaurant week and I got the pork belly and my girl got the flank steak. Both were very underwhelming. The potbelly was actually tasty but they only gave me 5 small pieces and rest of the dish was unappetizing. The steak was flavorless and chewy (we got medium) and the Brussels sprouts were just ok. This is with a very high price tag. I hoping this would be good but unfortunately it was a complete disappointment.

gAoXEo9huXCzgDCT6_PEPw.text: Fantastic cocktails at this location.  So good you'll definitely want to hold yourself back because it's certainly easy to have one too many.  Delicious appetizers as well.  Service is pretty good but drinks took a while during our happy hour.  Overall a great cocktail bar and very recommended.

mj949BENJi0iAb6eIXYanA.text: Great spot for dinner. They are on Open Table so easy to reserve ahead of time or for a weekend. First of all, if you are a cocktail drinker, they have an awesome assortment and make some creative concoctions. The menu is small, but detailed and creative. They have some great starters, including the charred octopus with chorizo and fingerling potatoes (DELICIOUS), pretzel brioche which comes with 3 butters, and the deviled eggs, all of which are fantastic. The 3 pretzel butters were pumpkin butter, a mustard seed butter and a cheerwine. They were each tasty in their own right, served atop of the pretzel bread which is keenly sprinkled with sea salt (excellent decision).  For our meals, we tried the catch of the day (a snapper), the duck and the sticky pork shank with peanuts and a chili sorghum glaze. The meat was so tender and fall of the bone delicious. For sides, we tried the esquites (warm corn salad) and the broccoli. To my surprise, the broccoli is served as one large piece, charred and covered with harissa, goat cheese and mustard. SO delicious.   For dessert, we HAD to dry the one lb donut, as it's been on my Charlotte Bucket List. We split it among 4 of us after all having apps and entrees and finished it. It is delicious, with a custard type cream in the middle, and covered with heath bar pieces. I could definitely eat more of that in the future :)  Service is great and the atmosphere is romantic.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Donut

Tl1nm3ixZAvOlY-z2Cm7gg.text: Husband and I had breakfast here before we left to head back  home. I will say; you are seeking variety for breakfast this may not be your first choice. The A.M. menu is limited to (3) "lite options", (7) full plate options and (12) side items to include the meats(4) and breads (3). I had the Avacado toast, which is served on Rye, over-medium eggs and sausage. My husband had stuffed French toast and an omelet.   My Avacado toast was different than what I'm used to; sliced and laid over the toast as opposed to smashed/blended w/olive oil, ricotta type cheese, but it was good. Eggs were fresh, prepared as ordered and though the sausage was good it didn't have any kick/spice, which may be fine for most.   My husband really enjoyed the stuffed French toast w/fruit and his omelet. The French toast was stuffed with a ricotta mixture, coated with Rice Crispys and cooked on a griddle I believe. Really different take on stuffed French toast but very tasty.   I was confused as to why we were served toast that seemed to have been toasted twice and a bit hard to eat but it was left on the plate as was my frustration with it!    Based on what appears to be a menu of fantastic fare, I think we would have really enjoyed the dinner as well but we had to get on the road so maybe next visit!

zUHmF-JoSA4fBLMaMNcI6g.text: So this review is a week overdue and my apologies to Samuel as I promised I would yelp right away but it took some time to get this right.   Person, place and thing.... Samuel, the amazing mixologist at Stoke! Personable and engaging with flair!   Place is Marriott Center City in Stoke, a comfortable contemporary bar with great ambiance to entertain business associates as well as meet friends for an after work or dinner drink.    Thing is by FAR the most amazingly delicious Old Fashioned I have EVER HAD!!! I could easily divulge the contents of said drink but I am reserving to do so in hopes you meet up with friends after dining out in uptown and stroll over to STOKE, a classy contemporary bar where the mixologists are knowledgeable and friendly, you can purchase an AMAZING cocktail with such a sweet flow of flavors and sit back and be an adult for an hour, enjoying the ambiance of STOKE where you hear good music but can still hear yourself think as well as your friends conversing.   Samuel!!! You are excellent at what you do.  You pour a fantastic drink and I have raved about that Old Fashioned to anyone who is looking for a great place to go. It was the flavor of that drink! By far one of the best drinks I have ever had in a bar the world over (yes I've traveled internationally many  times.)  Great job Samuel! Katie and I definitely give you five stars! You couldn't have done anything to make it better. It was perfection. Thank you.

nXXW_lwW3xPq52RuKQexzg.text: Hungry? You're in good hands with Stoke. They proudly make everything from scratch in an open kitchen using local ingredients and a whole lotta soul. They focus on southern foods that are simple, rustic yet refined.  My friends and I came for restaurant week and were blown away. We've been doing restaurant week for the last four years and Stoke is our favorite so far. We shared everything and enjoyed everything but we collectively agreed the smoked pork belly was the best dish of the night. We also agreed the donut holes we the best dessert of the night. But really, you can't go wrong with anything.

Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smores Ice Cream Sammie
Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Donut holes

ojk_plEzsO_Ab-9EzkqudA.text: I've been wanting to try Stoke so we decided to come for restaurant week. After we made reservation, it was announced that Chef Coleman was leaving so we were there for his last night.   We had an early reservation and were seated right away. We were seated with a great view of the open kitchen which was cool.   There were four of us and we split our appetizers of the deviled eggs, hushpuppies, sticky pork toast, and pan roasted scallop. They were the best hushpuppies I've ever had. The scallop was amazing and the pork toast was very unique.  For entrees, my husband and I split the smoked pork belly and the catfish. They were both incredible. The pork belly was probably my favorite, but it was a small portion.   I finished with the donut holes for dessert. They were awesome. Three big donut holes with a ton of cream to go with them. No Heath crumbles for me since I don't like chocolate.   The vibe is relaxed even though it's a very nice restaurant. It's not stuffy at all.   I'd definitely recommend coming here for a nice dinner and hope the next chef carries on what chef Coleman started.

Vbx0hdjKnbH8RgG1rxOSbg.text: I stayed at the Marriott where this restaurant is attached to and wanted a meal where I didn't have to walk outside too. After reading these reviews and all the "hype" of this restaurant, I must say they DO NOT deserve the rating they have.  The only good thing about my experience was the server was attentive and professional. Everything else was awful!!! For starters I ordered a farm salad was brought over a scallop dish. I am highly allergic to scallops and thankfully I did not have any of this. Then I ordered the flat iron steak. I asked for it medium rare. I don't know what happened but I had a few pieces and then noticed how rare it was. I immediately felt sick to my stomach and stopped eating.  I went up to my room and a couple hours later had symptoms of food poisoning. I was up all night in the bathroom and this was the only meat I had ate all day!! I am greatly upset with the whole experience. The manager Took off my glass of wine on the bill which I only drank half of anyway because I felt so sick!  STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT!!! Unless you want food poisoning!!!

6kvWdB5c7u4i94KxZ7_XEg.text: Pretty great for a restaurant in a hotel! The menu was small but everything in the group liked their meals. The small menu was, in fairness, the brunch menu still but it was around 2 and some more options (especially gluten free) would have been great.   Overall, the ambiance was cozy and friendly the food was pretty good.  I'll try to make it back for dinner and see what's going on and update if I do!

YlbTZdUbOQykOwtnuczl0Q.text: Interesting layout where the kitchen is completely visible to all. It adds to the overall experience and ambience on one's visit. First visit I was pleasantly surprised and now I go just because of its uniqueness. Menu has been kept simple which I'm sure is purposeful and for which I'm grateful. The food is well priced and taste. I recommend the BBQ dipped chicken sandwich however have the sauce on the side so you can dip to your likeness. Chef can get carried away at times lol

sCIazPqSnEwNbrpQqQCp7w.text: I've been here a few times for dinner and had a great experience, however I went for brunch recently and honestly was extremely disappointing.   First, there either isn't a drink menu or we weren't offered one. Made it difficult to know how expensive anything was. I ordered the avocado toast with over medium eggs and was severely disappointed. First my over medium eggs were overcooked to over hard eggs, which I'm just not a huge fan of and then the avocado toast was simply sliced avocado on toast. Nothing else, no lime juice, salt anything that could be considered seasoning.   Also I have allergies and I had to ask the kitchen to change their gloves because either my waitress didn't say anything, or the chef disregarded my allergies. It's an open kitchen so I was watching them handle things I was allergic to and then get to my food  Lastly service wasn't great this time around. Overall just had to wait for our waitress from everything from water, to ordering, to our check.   The setting here is really nice and I've definitely enjoyed the two dinners I've had here. Would come back just not for brunch

SCopUiAaK_kZnohfZbi8ag.text: I came here for queens feast with my boyfriend and another couple and it was a fantastic experience. We got to choose one option from three different courses- appetizer, entree and dessert. I got the pan seared scallop which was AMAZING! It was in a green pea bisque which was astonishingly tasty. I wasn't completely sure what to expect of a pea soup but it was slightly sweet and paired perfectly with the scallop. For my entree I got the flat iron steak cooked medium and it was perfect. It came with a warm corn salad that was sweet and savory in all the best ways. One of the other people I went with got the smoked pork belly and I think hands down it was the best dish I tried all night. The pork belly was on top of a brick of sticky rice with some sauce on it and I wish I had gotten that dish instead. My only issue with it was that it was a noticeably smaller portion than all the other entree dishes. For dessert my boyfriend got the doughnut holes which was a smaller rendition of their infamous one pound (yes 1 lb!) doughnut. Basically the chef took that large doughnut and pulled pieces from it to make smaller balls rolled in cinnamon sugar with diplomat cream topped with crushed Heath bar. That was stellar and I'd recommend trying their normal doughnut to anyone who had the opportunity to. All around I'd definitely encourage everyone to go to Stoke

uq_zH8NbdiCUohryiClQZw.text: Came here twice during my recent trip to Charlotte since I was staying at the Mariott and had a great experience both times! The restaurant is pretty spacious and located in the lobby of the hotel, with a bar area as well as a main dining area. The food/drinks and service were great, and the ambiance is upscale but still relaxed, which I was super into.  I tried a few of their cocktails, all of which were tasty and unique. The pretzel brioche with whipped butters was delicious and the scallops were also amazing (and huge!!). The Brussel sprouts were pretty good as well.  Overall, I would recommend Stoke to anyone in the Charlotte area. While the menu is definitely on the pricier side, I thought it was worth the money!

uEtECwM2GuTnhlvdnIk0rQ.text: What a nice little eatery in the hotel lobby of the Marriott in City Center of Charlotte, NC.  Coming from San Diego, CA, I honestly wasn't sure what types of adjustments I'd have to make in order to understand businesses in these parts.  Granted, it's inside a hotel, so the standards need to be at least at par with the hotel itself.  It had the whole open-view concept.  You could see the place from the lobby, and you could see inside the kitchen from the dining area.  It looked very elegant, yet casual enough to feel absolutely comfortable.  Food was well-made. The omelette was delicious, but the two things that ended up unexpectedly stealing the show were the oatmeal and the butter.  The oatmeal had to have been slow-cooked over a certain period of time because it was so soft and not what I expected at all.  I'm glad I was able to have the appetite for it.  And the butter was so good.  It was soft from probably being freshly-whipped, and it had a very sweet flavor to it that made me want to use more of it.  Server was not only helpful, but also a riot.  She had very good recommendations from the menu as well as affirming reactions to our official choices.  It made me believe that there was not going to be a bad choice no matter what we decided to order.  On top of all that, she was funny, witty, and engaging.  The rest of the staff was great too.  Parking:  Since we did not drive during our whole time here, I honestly cannot speak on this aspect.  The streets tend to be narrow in this area, and I did not notice much street parking at all.  FYI:  - Open to all who can venture here.  You do not need to be a guest at the hotel to dine here. - They can accommodate for large parties.

y0JGf-j9p--p9ZRFW2u6CQ.text: We brought the mother her on Mother's Day and called ahead to make a reservation just in case. It's tucked away inside the Marriott, it's very open with brass fixtures and pieces.  Our waitress came up and provided us with water and mimosas. A slight delay on her return during the entire service which is the reason for the 3 stars. We even had to stack our own dirty plates.  I ordered the steak sandwich (med rare) w/ pimento cheese and fries. The fries were a mixture of fresh fries and slight over cooked ones. The sandwich was another story, very moist with amazing texture.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak Sandwich

52Y8v75OoN9Y7Ye3N9arkQ.text: There's a right way and a wrong way for businesses to do Restaurant Week in Charlotte. I think most Charlotteans that keep their finger on the pulse of the local restaurant scene know exactly what I'm talking about. Far too often I've given a place a chance only to find that their food isn't up to par, portions are scaled back way too much, or the business simply can't handle the influx of customers. The folks at Stoke should be the model that every other restaurant strives to be for Queen's Feast!  Reservations for 6:45, we arrive at 6:35 and are seated immediately. To my surprise, we are seated just steps away from the open kitchen. All night long we are able to watch Chef Chris Coleman plate some stellar looking food with such precision all the while making sure every dish was perfectly presented. Our waiter (also named Chris) was friendly and took the time to explain both menus being served that night and suggested some beers for us.  The food wasn't the only thing that was amazing looking. The entire restaurant is what I would call "rustic-modern" with a warm, spacious floor plan. I'm not sure which one steals the show more, the massive bar or the open kitchen! My first visit left me wanting to come back equally for the food and the atmosphere.  On to Dinner and my girlfriend and I chose three courses exclusively from the Restaurant Week menu. Another note on their menu for this event: They have a lot more options than most restaurants usually offer. 8 Appetizers, 6 Entrees, and 4 Desserts. Since me and Kristen split most of the plates, I'll list 'em all from first to last bite.  Mom's Deviled Eggs: These are perfect little bites of flavor explosion. Seasoning was spot on, not everything has to be overbearingly salty, spicy, or tangy, which is what you normally encounter with deviled eggs. Topped with butter pickles and aleppo chile, it was the perfect amount of sour and heat. While regular red chile is a one-hit wonder, aleppo dials the heat down a bit with subtle southwest hints of fruit and spice.  F&S Hushpuppies: These have utterly destroyed hushpuppies for me. Never again will I be able to go to your average greasy spoon and order 'em, they won't stand a chance. Fried to perfection, which I would call a couple of seconds beyond golden brown, and served with simple honey and butter. The seasoning, the butter, the honey, it was just amazing. What really made it sing? Order a Birdsong Jalapeno Pale Ale and enjoy plate of these with it. You'll thank me later.  BBQ Half Spring Chicken: This was my girlfriend's entree as the fettuccine & shrimp she was eyeing had pine nuts in it, and unfortunately she's allergic. Regardless, I saw no sign of regret as she rolled her sleeves up and devoured the chicken with her hands! I mean, really, there's no better way to mow down a bone-in bird. Again, a real simple dish but the execution on these simple ingredients are so carefully crafted they simply shine. Red grits were wholesome, thick, and delicious.  Sticky Pork Belly: When this plate first came out I was a little disappointed in the portion size. That soon changed when I realized how much flavor this piece of pork was packing. After the first bite I stared to cut my pork into tiny pieces just to savor it for a bit longer. The seared glaze on top gave the dish an amazing crunch with a hearty texture underneath in every bite. The squash and 'quick' pickles paired so well with this dish.  BONUS Dish - Charred Octopus: So hats off to Chef Chris, he sent our table a small plate of the charred octopus. I got to admit, octopus is something I probably wouldn't have voluntarily ordered but I'm so glad I was able to try it here. The char gave the edges of the octopus this perfect crunchy texture and it almost reminded me of a more toothsome version of lobster. Paired with fingerling potatoes, spicy chorizo and aioli, it all came together to make one of the best small plates I've had in uptown.  "The Doughnut" (Holes): I think this is the perfect way to enjoy a single serving of what is probably Stoke's most famous "Instagram-worthy" dish. I can't tell you what's better, the doughnut itself or the Diplomat Cream it's served with. Warm perfect texture with a crisp exterior, sweet and complex diplomat cream that has just the right amount of richness, and the Heath crumbles on top just nail all the criteria for a slam dunk dessert.  Chef Chris and his team are doing amazing things here. Now two visits in, I can honestly say I haven't had a single disappointing or even average dish. This dinner just had me blown away with the thoughtful combinations, every flavor worked so well with each other. Next time I'd probably request the kitchen to just surprise me, bring me what they like, it'd be a first! Thanks to everyone at Stoke for such an amazing evening. This was just one night ago and I'm already wanting to come back.  'Nuff Said

ZHNBKueek7ZhGICgJYMmyw.text: Stoke was amazing. My friend and I chose to do Sunday Brunch here and mark it off our long list of brunch spots. We both ordered the French toast and The Usual. My favorite item was the banana bread loaf. It was amazing. I have zero complaints about this restaurant and will definitely return.

bUQQRRaVPaB78JmbA0zH_g.text: Came here for Father's Day lunch. Made a reservation for a group of 5 for 1pm on OpenTable. We arrived about 10 minutes early, were greeted immediately, but was asked to wait for our table to be ready. The restaurant was busy, but not packed. The restaurant is located inside the Marriott. It's not that big, but there's plenty of seating. Parking is valet only, but the restaurant validates the parking.  We were seated withing 5 minutes. Our server was Colby (I think?) and she was fantastic. She was friendly and attentive throughout the entire meal.  We ordered: Garbage fries $9 Trout $18 Chicken BLT $10 Steak sandwich $10 The burger $12 Shrimp & Grits $18 1 lb donut  We asked for the gravy on the side for the garbage fries, and we actually enjoyed it better without the gravy. We loved the size and crispiness of the fries. Our orders were cooked to our liking. We really enjoyed the flavors. The portions were great and prices were reasonable. My son loved his shrimp and grits. He devoured the shrimp in minutes. I only finished half of my steak sandwich and took the rest to go. It was delicious and very filling. My husband and mother had difficulty finishing their orders as well. My mother took half of her chicken BLT to go, too. The donut was amazing! Even with 5 people, we could not finish it. We definitely took the rest to go and ate it later that day for snack.   Great experience and great meal. We will definitely return!

omUsOzHFpYgGqi5FhtuA_A.text: This bar has some solid cocktails and a casual atmosphere. It's located inside the Marriott Hotel. The bartender Sam is excellent! A good place to go if you aren't trying to wait in a line when you go out.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. French 75 made with vodka instead of gin, my favorite here

140PLojFqBkVW1O2W08PEA.text: Prob worth 3.5 stars. It was good but not the hype I had heard. I also found out after the group and I ate there that they just recently had a C (70s) sanitation score...but it was corrected/higher when we ate there. Still...what on earth did they do to get a low score like that? Gross. Shared some apps - pretzel bread was delicious with the diff types of butter. Wish I had more of it! Salad was unique, flavorful and colorful. I enjoyed it. The menu wasnt that impressive. The problem was we waited entirely too long for our food. The waitress knew we had a show to go to and we were there for over two hours, causing us to be late to show. If they served us in decent time, we would have all gotten dessert too but we missed out on that. If you go, just know you will be there for a long dining experience.

oHj2mTuuhDgJ81jzL7B-mA.text: Visited for restaurant week and the food was exceptional. I love when restaurants in uptown have complimentary parking so that is always a plus. The food is great, the atmosphere is OK but offer smaller portions. I would go back and suggest for a date night, not larger groups.

DFpWzs3K01UwTpJW0kmzaQ.text: This was a really special dinner for 7, that I will not forget.  They sat us at a marble table/bar, connected to the kitchen counter.  This was a great seat to get to watch the cooks at work, slicing prosciutto, plating entrees, etc.  We began with cocktails, which were interesting and well made.  I and a companion especially enjoyed the house version of an old fashioned.  Unlike some old fashioned, this had no muddled fruit, and had a burnt orange peel, which is just how I like it.  We ordered the pretzel brioche with three butters: cheerwine, a mustard butter, and I think a honey butter.  All 3 were good, but I especially enjoyed the cheerwine.  The bread was amazing, but not nearly enough was served for the amount of butter that comes with it.  Fortunately the waitress brought us some extra bread on the house.  We also had a mean and cheese platter (I think it was called "ham and cheese") which featured three fancy and delicious hams.    For my entree I had the duck, which was wonderfully crispy on the outside, and pink and juicy on the inside.  I would love to have that again.  For dessert we had the "one pound donut" (can't remember what it's called on the menu), which easily fed the table.  It was topped with a delicious creme fraiche/custard type confection, which was addictive.  I was especially impressed that they were able to cook this gigantic "donut" (it didn't have a hole - it was more like a big square pillow) evenly and perfectly, so that it was crunchy on the outside, airy on the inside, and didn't have any undercooked parts.  Our waitress was excellent - friendly, helpful, informed, and attentive.  I would love to return.

TwbvWC04G5zwmkMrx5JSOQ.text: We got the set menu with an appetizer, entree, and dessert all for $35 which was a phenomenal deal. The scallop for appetizer was cooked to perfection and the sauce that came with it was also very rich in flavor and had a complex taste profile. It was very delightful. The cook on my steak was also a perfect medium-rare and it rested on a bed of squash puree that was very delicious. The sorbet was also one of the best that I've had. It had a very rich peach flavor with fresh peach chunks and a slight saltiness for the finishing touch. Some of the people that I went with really didn't like it and preferred the donut holes but I really loved the sorbet. The kitchen was also very open and you can see the chiefs cooking. The atmosphere was good and the service was very good. I would recommend people going there.

Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallop

JpFgl2p_k8o_kP6O5uejRg.text: I found Stoke on YouTube. I watched someone stop in to try Stoke's crazy big take on a Boston cream donut, and I knew I had to come in for dinner.   Dani was friendly and gave us great recommendations. She refilled our drinks without request and periodically checked in with us about the food. The menu is simple, but it has something for everyone -- think a fresh twist on comfort food. Mom's Deviled Eggs are great, the Hush Puppies tasted crisp (and not too greasy), and the Pretzel Brioche comes with three equally awesome butter spreads. The Wood Fire Chicken is big enough to split between two people, and the chicken was well seasoned and cooked perfectly.   Dessert was what I looked forward to most, and The Doughnut did not disappoint, oh my God. The name might make it sound ordinary, but it beats every regular donut I've ever had. The Doughnut is massive, it can feed the whole table and the Heath Bar topping is a great touch. If you come to Stoke and don't try it, you're missing out!

SqyUKxl7DttYmkMGtgZMdQ.text: We had a really great experience here. The restaurant now fairly big and open. We expected it to be loud based on the way it looked, but it really wasn't.  We were able to enjoy the conversation at our table during the entire meal.  Also the view of the open kitchen is pretty great.  I enjoyed seeing every dish that came out and it gave me some ideas for next time for sure.    The service was prompt and polite and very good.  We ordered the Pretzel Brioche and the Farmer's Salad as appetizers.  The Pretzel Brioche was served with three butters- honey butter, cheerwine butter (my favorite) and a mustard butter. All were delicious. The Farmer's Salad was also very tasty with crunchy chickpeas and a carrot dressing.  These were a perfect start to our meal.  Two of us split the Woodfired chicken and the braised carrots.  The chicken sits atop a plate of polenta.  It was a  very tasty dish.  The rub/seasoning on the chicken was perfect and the chicken was juicy. I could have eaten an entire plate of just the polenta- it was excellent.  The carrots were an excellent side to this dish and had me coming back for more.  For dessert we had the doughnut which an entire table could split.  It was everything we had heard it would be.  Probably the best doughnut I've ever tasted by itself, then when you consider the cream and the Heath bar topping, it just can't be beat.  We definitely took some home and I'm happy to report it tasted just as amazing out of the fridge the next day. (Definitely wasn't letting any of it go to waste!)  We'll be back to Stoke for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Doughnut (and view of the kitchen)
Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Doughnut
Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Woodfired Chicken and Braised Carrots

F0bXbeDcSOAqLMTr0mAvbQ.text: Wonderful service, amazing food. The cocktails are fantastic-if you don't try the Stoke Fashioned you'll regret it forever. As for starters, the pretzel brioche melts in your mouth like cotton candy and deviled eggs were sublimely tangy. The Carolina shrimp and clams features the chef's mother's gumbo broth recipe which is heavenly when sopped up with some of the left over pretzel brioche. The Carolina gold rice grits paired well for a little shrimp-n-grits action. The lamb shoulder was perfectly prepared and beyond delicious. The blistered tomatoes sat on a cushion of stracciatella; I could eat this everyday for the rest of my life. My only regret is not saving enough room for the giant doughnut I keep hearing about!

owSyJlixn3WLRvChTYZjQg.text: Our second visit to Stoke was similar to the first - mediocre service and hits and misses on the food. Both visits, friendly service, but inattentive and WAY unprofessional.  Our server tonight was too busy sharing her experience of whatever to inquire why I hadn't eaten much of my dinner (it was TOO salty!). Both visits I got the avocado toast, both times the avocado had too many brown spots.  Ordered the shrimp and clams, the broth was so salty, I sent it back and ordered a salad which came around when all of my dining companions had finished their meals.  We love the chef, he used to cook at The Asbury, although we have not seen him at the restaurant.  If the chef or the manager were overseeing the restaurant, these issues would not have happened twice.

9Brd7QjTJ9YeMlFeeHWtBQ.text: They spent all the money on the chefs.  Food great. Wait staff and hostess were like Wal-Mart refugees. This low unemployment rate is causing an upscale restaurant dystopia.

JWlR-TjRxKL14gGrfp44sw.text: Had lunch here today and waited almost 45 minutes to receive our order. We had the fried catfish sandwich and the market fish of the day,  which was a red snapper with a vegetable melody.  I also had a small side order of fries which were supposed to be seasoned with lemon and cracked black pepper; I detected neither but the fries did have an over abundance of salt.  Both the catfish sandwich and the snapper were very good, but given Stoke has only been open for about 3 weeks now, I will let them work the kitchen kinks out over time before I go back.  We had to woof our food down in 15 minutes to get back to work for a 2pm meeting.  Stoke needs to get their act together if they expect to serve the Charlotte lunch crowd.....

ymHrxmU6skbNNd1f_Mf-5Q.text: Food was boring and dry.  Not much selection.  Loud..

98EXNKewW72xZTmClpPCPg.text: Food mediocre, service indifferent, noisy atmosphere, low value for dollar. Not even an average big hotel lunchery.

YaxEoTOvYAa-jHp205_qkA.text: Most amazing experience in dinning in Charlotte . A fan of everything on menu across the board . Thought out apps to great dinner options . Best hospitality service great time thanks to all for making this experience a memory. Chef Chriss and everyone good luck.

TKHNmSd6coTyFUdfyX3OPg.text: Our experience may not have been typical because it was the night a big snow and ice storm was to roll in, so even though it was a Friday night there were not many other diners in the restaurant.    I imagine on a busy night it becomes much noisier.  The hostess was very nice and chatted with us for awhile and our server was attentive and knowledgeable.  He spent time with us as well, as we waited for the third person in our party to arrive.  We started with the pretzel brioche & butter which looked way bigger when I viewed other reviewers' photos.  I was surprised by how small it was.  But, it was just the right size not to spoil your dinner!  And it was warm and delicious on a cold night.  I had a large "simple green salad" for dinner which was good (lettuces, fennel, orange, chevre, pomegranate).  The two gentleman with me had entrees:  shrimp & lobster paella and a lamb dish with pasta.  They both enjoyed their meals.  We also ordered and shared 2 sides:  brussels sprouts and beets, both were tasty. The big donut dessert was the star of the meal for me and we also had a chocolate board dessert sampler.  Our cost including tip was $180 for three people.  This included one cocktail, one glass of wine and an iced tea.  The restaurant is beautiful and the booth was comfortable.  We had an enjoyable meal before attending a Charlotte Symphony concert.

szo7uRneBBbAIDH07BKfig.text: Ambiance is good. Food is eh. Cocktails are eh but not to pricey. Servers need smaller sections to be able to tend to guests better.

j21s_UBpzzY0UHBtOh5RGg.text: From the moment we walked in, we knew we were going to have a wonderful dining experience, and we did! The vibe and decor set-up an festive atmosphere, and you can tell everyone is enjoin themselves.  We were lucky to sit at the Chef's Table, so we got to witness all the culinary magic happening!  We enjoyed the local ham and cheese platter for our appetizer, and then shared the roasted chicken, cooked tomatoes, and pimento mac and cheese, all delicious and plenty for the the two of us.  The creative cocktails, and bottles of wine made the meal complete! We're looking forward to returning, and hope to save room for dessert next time! Welcome to the neighborhood!

0lNVVn6umS8-9tjFfFNADA.text: Ambiance was lively.  Service was good.  Drinks were very good.  Food?  Meh.  Too salty.

wnTAs0ELm_iifYCfSTMngQ.text: My husband took me here for my birthday dinner and it was delicious. From the craft cocktails to the cheese board and entree, we loved everything. The cheddar rice grits were amazing and we loved the pork shank too! Service was excellent as well. We will be back!

2-gE05KVdfSQQeg8uCk3fQ.text: We have "date night" every Wednesday and Stokes was a good surprise - great great service and excellent small plates - as all hotel restaurants a little pricey for the servings but the charcuterie was good and the donut desert was a take home prize.  All in all good food and great service.

0wFt-AbKS7izvy6TUe_5Xg.text: Came here on Valentine's Day. The service was phenomenal and the food was perfect!  Best oysters and best grits I've had.

LjxfT11uLVDp8Xqkqbz4mA.text: I had heard great things about STOKE and knew it was a tough dinner reservation. So opted for a business lunch yesterday. And STOKE did not disappoint! Love the farm-to-table menu with local ingredients. And the service was outstanding! Shoutout to our waitress Ali! Such a pro. Went above and beyond to get one of my lunch guests what she requested, even though it was not on the menu. With the great food and service we experienced at STOKE, it should become one of Charlotte's top restaurants. Can't wait to try it for dinner!

dEqXznwWm35YCV1MYPHPBg.text: Amazing dinner! Went here for dinner with friends to celebrate one of their birthday. The ambience is perfect for groups, a few dinner guests, as well as for couples night. Food was amazing! Management friendly, attentive, and interested in all enjoying the restaurant.  The only suggestions to work on would be the mac and cheese (when everything else is amazing, basic sides, a la mac & cheese MUST be extraordinary), and the bartender should be able to make amazing drinks beyond their signature cocktails. Otherwise food was outstanding (had trout special, lamb, pork shank, butternut squash, smoked deviled eggs, and THE DONUT!!!) Will absolutely be back....many times!

Cgcyd_hXngJUrdwK_zK-OA.text: Farm to table style restaurant in the Marriott. Excellent service. Great food. Cool atmosphere. Definitely worth going if you're looking for a good meal with quick service.

yS4Qa3M7riNbK7xCxKUraw.text: Just went for cocktails after work and the tall chairs are terrible to sit it, but the drinks were really good and the cheese plate was great.  Will be going back for sure!

pTbckIJqgWLTx9-FU4E7WA.text: We were travelling from out of town and met a friend here for dinner.  We happened to be staying in the Marriot, which is where the hotel is located, so we couldn't have asked for a better location.  Very hip, open design.  The restaurant was comfortable and spacious, and our server was spectacular.  The cocktails were excellent (their pressed cocktails are something unique and  flavorful, served in a French press).  We ordered the pretzel brioche (excellent!) and the cheeseboard (good, but not worth the $30 price tag) to start.  Our friend had the fish of the day, and we had the chicken and the pork shank.  Everything was beautifully presented and very flavorful.  The corn and potato sides were also delicious.  The only thing I might say is that at a lot of other restaurants at this price point, the portions are small (which I have no problem with...quality over quantity), but usually there are some type of "sides" included that make it still a complete, albeit small, meal.  Here, the portions are small, but for that price no sides are included...everything is ala carte.  That's really the only criticism I can think of.  Other than that, this is another great example of an establishment that is destroying the old negative stereotype of the "hotel restaurant" that was so prevalent even ten years ago.  Farm to fork, ingredient-focused, and innovative cuisine.  We'd definitely stop back.

khdvgdQQQCg_7Qu5e1vAOA.text: I checked into the hotel on a Tuesday night for a conference that started the next day. It was 8pm and I was hungry so decided to check out the hotel's main restaurant.  Having been to several great farm-to-table restaurants in northern VA and in Texas, I decided to try it out.  I ordered the pork shank and the carolina rice grits (both recommended as most popular items on the menu) with a gin cocktail.  The cocktail was pretty good, but the food was a major disappointment.  The pork came in this sticky brown sauce sprinkled with sesame seeds (sorry "benne seeds").  The sauce was tasteless except for an over abundance of salt.  I couldn't have them refill my water glass fast enough - it was that salty.  The "grits" were bizarre.  White rice similar to an overcooked watery risotto with white cheese (which you couldn't taste in the dish) covered with a poached egg (white as well) and what I suspect to be a drizzle of olive oil or maybe it was the melted fat from the cheese?  It's kind to say the dish looked less appetizing than the menu made it sound.  Unlike the pork, the rice was severely under seasoned, and the texture of the entire dish was mushy (think really mushy rice pudding).  After tax and tip, I paid about $50 for one person and I wished I went to Coco & the Director for a hamburger instead.  Considering the plethora of other solid 4 star restaurants within 1-2 block radius of the hotel, it really is amazing this place can charge as much as it does with the food it produces and remain in business.  For the signature restaurant in a Marriott hotel, this was a major disappointment.

IkBOtssxo5f00Qsbjpj41Q.text: So we've been here a few times, only for drinks though. Old Fashioned is one of the best in town. Good craft selection. Made custom drinks at request of my wife, all of which she loved. Have laid eyes on the pork shank a few times and it looks amazingly delicious. All the bartenders are very nice. Place also has pretty cool ambiance. Will be back to grab some food at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Old Fashioned

UbQQz5qYR-49PXN7s5MSAA.text: In October shortly after the grand opening I visited Stoke to enjoy some libations and eats...it was my first visit and I wasn't disappointed.   Yelp family...I'm the single girl who goes to the bar to people watch and experiment with the drink menu, nothing like cold, stiff well crafted libation...Stoke had me covered.   They have a signature Old Fashion, while I hate ordering what everyone orders, I eventually but the bullet. There's a list of preinfused crafted drinks they will let you sample before selecting - great options and then UNIQUE was a pressed drink menu. It's served to you in a French press...it was fly!   Burger - slammin' Bartenders- awesome Price - get what you pay for...  Atmosphere- drippin with swanky & sexy Date night - sure could, I actually walked out with a stranger and we kept bar hopin...just sayin!

nqHgVpRsRbtcXlnG8KlbnQ.text: Wonderful environment and definitely unique that they served water in large brown bottles. Health score was really low, but I understand that the kitchen is completely open and they work in a small space. The food was wonderful, especially the charred broccoli kale salad. Charred octopus could have been cooked better, but otherwise everything was delightful. Parking is validated through the valet, not the parking garage next door.

g8x_OcwBKryJfEJ5i2qpWQ.text: Good eats! I didn't get a chance to get dessert was too full maybe next time. Had the octopus- great texture and flavor and scallops were cooked nicely. The sauce was a little bland for my taste buds but not bad. Had bread with 3 types of butter all delicious. The drink cocktails were good/unique and strong enough. I would have liked more frequent water refills. Good ambiance inside Marriott hotel .

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops
Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Octopus

0qmKl1j-D_74K8LBkU8qcg.text: Stoke has just officially taken over "my favorite restaurant" spot in Uptown!  I adore that you can see the chefs at work from your table. The menu was just the right size for my taste...big enough for a nice selection, but small enough so you know each and every dish is well crafted with fresh ingredients! They have gorgeous wall coverings listing all the local and regional spots where they source ingredients.  The service could not have been any better. Pamela was the best! She knew the menu and drink list inside and out and explained each in detail with every question we had. She paced our courses nicely and was always available when we needed, but gave us plenty of time to eat and socialize without rushing us. The food!!!! The food!!!! The pretzel brioche was a great starter with 3 delicious spreads. I filled up with mouthwatering pork shank and brussel sprouts. But always always save room for The Doughnut...Yes w a capital D! It will easily feed a family, but you can always take the leftovers home too! Can't wait to go back.

Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese Board

EnXokMOInjD6IN-BxMvzYg.text: Small menu.  Lamb tacos were good but greasy.  My partner had a chicken sandwich.  He didn't like it.  The taste of the sauce was overwhelming.

4cEUWyN2mFNzwV8-h5_LOw.text: I made the trip downstairs from the hotel room in hopes that breakfast would still be served around 10:30am. I seated myself and was promptly tended to by a server, who I later learned her name was Maria. Let me start with the atmosphere-casual, clean, crisp, comfy and loved the masons jar silverware display on the tables. I ordered an omelette-with bacon, cheddar, and onions. It came with white toast, not what I had ordered, but Maria graciously made the change, as she was the one that recommended I give the banana bread a try and I'm so glad that I did. The food was delish! I also ordered hot tea and i was delivered my own personal kettle and matching mug and was provided a new tea bag and a to go cup as well. Maria was very sweet, and attentive. She was personable and genuinely seemed interested in making her interactions with me by asking about my football team( I was wearing a buffalo bills shirt) and asking what brought me to town. Thank you for a great meal and great service! Keep up the great work

Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beautiful set up!
Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Such a nice presentation and discovered my new favorite brand of tea!

gYyzP5s4eHC60lz8rvv4Mw.text: Made reservations at Stoke on a Friday night to celebrate a birthday and an anniversary with family, and I have never had a better experience at a restaurant. Our waitress was attentive and excited to explain the new menu to us and provide us with both food and drink recommendations, and we were not disappointed. Everything we had from the pork to the charred octopus was fabulous, but we (thankfully) saved a little room for the home made donut dessert. We were also lucky enough to get to taste a new pork belly dish they were testing in the kitchen.  Long story short: we will definitely be back!

WNbCh2omOKHeiW8M4M3gkw.text: Ok tasting food that's made quickly. While it's farm to table it's odd to have a tomato soup menu option then say it's off the menu because tomatoes are out of season.

QD8Tegj8JMnLaYXv-oA-2Q.text: We chose this restaurant based upon the reviews and we were not disappointed!  Our family was visiting Charlotte and had a group of 10 for lunch.  We were seated at the chef table and loved seeing all that was going on in the kitchen!   Pamela our server was FANTASTIC.... She answered numerous questions from our "foodie" group.  We got several sides to share as well as the wonderful heirloom tomato salad.  Members in our group got everything from the catfish sandwich to chicken to Farro Salad to beef flat iron.  All were excellent -fresh and flavorful.    As we were ordering I briefly mentioned to Pamela that we were celebrating the engagement of our "children" ( parents meeting grandparents etc...).  We briefly wondered why desert plates were placed at our table after our dishes were cleared .... I wondered if this was a way to "push" desert ( we all declared we were stuffed).  Moments later Pamela presented to the engaged couple "THEDoughnut!   Oh My!   This was a huge doughnut- almost 12 inches wide ..filled with a chantilly cream ( or similar wonderful filling). She said it was compliments for our celebration.  The ten of us all enjoyed a piece and it was amazing.    I highly recommend "Stoke" don't let the fact it is located inside the Marriott Hotel deter you..... This place is not to be missed!

TR_Cj9-DvSCEyfHOeus-Ow.text: I've been here three times now. After my first time I wanted to write a 5-star review simply based on the octopus, which was the best octopus I've ever had in my life. Cooked the wrong way, octopus comes out tough and chewy. This was the opposite of that: soft and butter-like. Like nothing I've ever had before.   Then I visited again a few weeks later and the octopus was mediocre. I sent it back. The waitress brought back another but it still wasn't great. I asked the waitress what happened. Apparently it depends on who is working in the kitchen. She told me the name of the "good chef" but I've forgotten it by now.  Long story short: get the octopus, but ask your waiter or waitress first to make sure the right person is working in the kitchen.

C16xd5mZ3OBCD92hsOZ8Ng.text: Amazing service, great food. Just wow. Great creations that are surprisingly North Carolinian. Cheerwine butter? I mean heck yeah! Just great, highly recommend.

nEuHQ4pcCFyfwZIElEugQg.text: We had a group of 8 at dinner on 12/17.  First, it is way over priced for what you get.  I am an avid foodie and have no problem paying for quality but I personally had a small piece of Sea Bass as my entree and it was $28.  My wife had a few shrimp, a few clams and some broth.  No sides, nothing.  We ordered sides. The sides which are pitched as "family style" are great if you have a family of one.  The service was mediocre.  Our waitress was not very good at cleaning up.  The only positive is the style and ambience.  That is great and the open kitchen concept is nice.  Now maybe comparing this to Dressler's, Del Frisco, Essex, Custom Shop, Good Food and other great Charlotte restaurants is where I went wrong.  It is not in any of those restaurants league.

qPPQkNpOmnNpaygfz48W6w.text: Last weekend my husband and I wanted to get out in uptown Charlotte and spend some $ at restaurants and bars since they suffered recently due to the unrest. So, we went to Stoke for dinner and what a great spot it is. First of all, nice open spot right off of the Marriott lobby which was quite welcoming with high ceilings. We had made a reservation but there were some open tables at 7:30 when we went. The service was on point, especially since our server went to the kitchen and asked the chef how he prepared the octopus starter for us after we inquired. That was the most tender octopus we have had and we pretty much order it on every menu we see it on. A main reason to go is the wine by the glass/bottle sold at retail prices. We shared a bottle of French rose that set us back a whole $21.00. Awesome. Next...food. I selected the Carolina shrimp and clams in a gumbo broth. I could tell that broth took a while to make and it hit the spot. My husband ordered the Iron Skillet Mountain Trout and he essentially got a whole fish. Very generous portion. What got me in the door of this restaurant though was seeing that they had roasted carrots with carrot top pesto. Did NOT disappoint! Remember, pretty much everything is passed through that wood fired oven. It is called Stoke after all.

photos.caption: Photo of Stoke Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Argentinian rosè for 19 bucks a bottle.

DV_dUyX3XJObBN1vJRJdOA.text: I stumbled onto Stoke which just opened, and Charlotte should be stoked (sorry, I couldn't resist). This farm to table restaurant has a huge open kitchen where it seems like diners can watch the chefs from every single table.  My trout was spot on, but the real winner was the service.  My server, Tysha, was absolutely incredible.  She knew the food, knew the wines, and literally sold me on the place before I even knew what it was all about.  If Chef Chris Coleman's waitstaff continues to be this incredible, then all the Uptown chain steak houses are in for serious competition.  I wish this place the very best!!  I ordered the Sunburst Farms trout because, quite simply, I screw it up when trying to cook it at home.  Sunburst Farms trout is a Carolina treasure, and Sunburst isn't too far of a drive from Charlotte.  But, I'm not a good cook, so I always mess it up when trying to cook it.  The trout I had at Stoke was just perfect.  Perfect.  I didn't order sides, but the dish came with some pickled okra and onions which were the perfect compliment to the trout.  Perfect.  Wines:  Tysha explained that Stoke isn't marking up the wine prices.  For that reason, I ordered an entire bottle of Malbec for the same price Total Wine charges.  What other restaurant at a "high-end hotel" is going to do that?  And, the manager came around a few times to see how everything was.  Incredible experience all the way around, and I'll be back to try it with friends and family.    I hope Stoke stays.  Now, a little history:  the restaurant at the Marriott used to be Savannah Red.  It taught Charlotte about farm to table dining long before we all realized the health and importance of farm to table experiences.  And, the kudzu butter and Krispy Kreme desserts taught us the importance of taking Carolina "stuff" and turning it into gastronomic extravaganzas.  I loved the decor at Savannah Red because it was unique in a way similar to Patrick O'Connell's Inn at Little Washington.  But, Savannah Red closed.    Down the street at the Dunhill Hotel, Cassie Parsons from Grateful Growers farm was also teaching Charlotte about farm to table dining at her Harvest Moon restaurant.  But, Cassie closed Harvest Moon at the Dunhill, and Chef Chris Coleman turned it into The Asbury.  He put his spin on farm to fork dining, and The Asbury is where I always took out of town guests for brunch.    A few nights ago, I stopped by the Marriott to see if their crazy renovations were over (the Marriott  did away with one of the best hotel indoor pool/spas in Charlotte), and near the lobby was this huge, new restaurant called Stoke.  I was in the mood for Ethiopian, so I absolutely did not intend to dine at Stoke.  But, the huge, open, airy layout was intriguing.  The host and waitstaff sucked me in, and I'm thrilled to have tried it.  Kudos, and thanks for a great dining experience.

CAQB-dLbCDWWMlkcfa1RZg.text: For the price we paid, it was very poor value. Went here for my wife's birthday on Christmas Eve. I appreciated that they let us move our reservation up from 7pm to 6pm.   However, my wife and I ordered the steak. For $40 a plate, we expected a fantastic cut. My wife ordered medium rare and it came over cooked. Mine was medium and it was acceptable but not fantastic. It was awkward having to send a dish back. Once both of us got what we ordered, it turned out to be a chewy and less than ideal cut.   The cheese board and charred octopus were good. The broccoli and sweet potato sides were ok.   No matter what the reviews say, next time I'll avoid the restaurant inside of a Marriott. 5Church down the street looked a lot more full and probably better.

IK_Mxhs1j6Vly0Ctw960Fw.text: The valet parking lost my friends keys to his vehicle because an attendant took his keys home on purpose. We waited over 90 minutes for the valet associate to return the key with no apology. The manager did nothing to alleviate the stress, anxiety and confusion. The food was decent which is the only reason for even one star. There are so many other choices in this area do not waste your time on this restaurant the customer service is terrible.

KQVw9jQhNjw-FgWzjlaM6A.text: Wow...one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had. Super excited to go here for brunch after reading the reviews. Yes, yes the ambience is good. The food was meh and the service was absolutely horrible. We saw our server once, when she took our order. We had to flag a manager down to get water. And he attempted to pour us a half a glass (what is that about!) and we had to ask for a full glass of water. I would've ordered another mimosa but if I can't even get water then I'm certainly not wasting my money on waiting forever for another drink. We had to flag the manager down again to get the check. Both times he had an excuse for the server, saying she got caught up at another table. Let me be clear, there were four tables in there. She had two of them, and the other one seemed to have the same issues. She brought us the check and apologized, saying she had to be in the kitchen as a chef. Being that the kitchen is an open concept, we could clearly see that there were three chefs and she hadn't been in there at all. What a horrible experience!

6aAnwq_0cWI9Yed8Lez24A.text: Probably my least favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Usually food is too salty and inconsistent portion sizes. Generally great service, food is just meh

ZdKj9WRs97CSGvC-pNHIsg.text: Simply amazing.  We were initially hesitant because it's a hotel restaurant but don't let that stop you.  Everything from the cocktails to dessert was unbelievable.  We will be back.

IwrIt1v9a3oCWioXeU2K-w.text: Went here for Christmas Night dinner. Not only was there a set menu that they didn't tell us about, but the food was horrible. Seems like a nice place with great staff but food was awful. The food was not edible. Worst meal I have ever had. A crappy set menu was 65$ a person! Unfortunately, it seemed like the waiter knew that the food was bad but couldn't do anything about it. 0/5 do not attend.

FTfzy5No6JfCff1zi6nsTA.text: So I come here A LOT because my office is across the street and there is free wifi, the food is great... but most importantly the service is outstanding.  It's actually the reason I was compelled to stop everything I was doing and write this.  I came in today and ordered lunch and did some work at the bar.  My bartender and waiter's name is Juan, he was super friendly from the getgo... warm, welcoming, just chatty enough and did an incredible job checking in to make sure I was good.  But the best part was that I ordered a special and I guess it just wasn't my taste.  It was cooked perfectly but for some reason I just wasn't feeling it.  He noticed I didn't eat the main dish - he tried to get me something else, made recommendations, and was GENUINE.  I wasn't really all that hungry so I politely declined and without even asking had it comped.  When I went to pay my tab he said I already took care of it.  I hope you'll come back and let us try again with something else.  I mean, how often do you get care like that?  The food was phenomenal - just wasn't my preference for fish.  It had nothing to do with how it was cooked or anything.  It was 100% me and he was still so concerned and wanted to make sure my experience was great.  And it was.  It was great.  Thank you Juan!  For going above and beyond!  A stellar example of customer service.   I'll obviously be back.  PS - all of their salads are delicious.  Also the fried chicken - dang!  So good!

15cLStglosMUEzOTzasWrA.text: All I can say is YUM! We ordered the following for dinner & it was wonderful! Friendly and prompt service. Great atmosphere + modern decor. We'll definitely come back for more.   -  Iron Skillet Mountain Trout - I loved it!  - Wood Roasted Avocado Toast - My husband enjoyed this.  - BBQ Carrots - To our surprise, this was so flavorful. - Carolina Gold Rice Grits - Super creamy. I can just eat this alone and be happy ;) - THE Doughnut $18 (NOTE: This can honestly feed an entire village! My husband and I did our best & finished half)

h28AXgQVDqKyX-vNUmHAfw.text: My husband and I were staying in the hotel attached to the restaurant. So we popped in for some dinner. The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us a lot of details which helped us deciding on a main course. For the appetizer we had the pretzel brioche. It was to die for! The cheerwine butter was delicious. I had a fish with risotto. It was super fresh and tasty. They gave us a free dessert because we were newly weds! We had an awesome experience!

aEmDbIJZ1Tl2Be0eeUjqjA.text: Made a reservation for 2 via Open Table.  Arrived promptly on time.  Front-of-house staff seemed confused but did find the reservation in their system.  We were taken to a communal table that seats 6. reminded our hostess that we booked for 2 and said, "You're going to give us this entire table?"  She replied, "No, there will be others seated here too."  We left.  I checked Open Table and nowhere does it advise to expect communal seating at Stoke.  So, word to the wise: a reservation here is really one in name only and you could be seated anywhere -- with anyone!  Caveat Emptor.  Charlotte has too many good restaurants uptown to waste time with this sophomoric eatery.

bCxH2Wo2ePAkj1benAENCA.text: Although the food was delicious, one of the people in our party got choked, and instead of showing compassion, she was asked to "move it to the bathroom" by the manager!! She was clearly choking and not some drunk girl getting sick.  Someone else in our party got her outside for air and she was ok, but the manager's reaction was disappointing to say the least.  When he was confronted about this, after our meal, he was minimally apologetic, and never once appeared genuinely concerned. He said he didn't realize she was choking, even though she had her hand on her throat (universal signal for choking). I said he and his staff should be given sensitivity training with an emphasis on recognizing a customer in distress.  Even though it was not the restaurant's fault, I think the manager should have comped her meal or given a card for free dessert or something.  A gesture like that would go a long way in acknowledging the value of their customers.  Good customer service is the only thing that brings people in your establishment as there are plenty of other restaurants within a few steps of Stoke. As it is, the most memorable part of our evening was the nonchalant reaction to what could have been a life threatening event.

b5qRfYffVByy9IiM5bKuCw.text: Well whaddya' know. Another farm-to-fork venue. Gettin' to where if you open a restaurant in Charlotte, it BETTER source locally, or else you've got no leg to stand on. That being said, the challenge of making THAT original and new is sometimes a struggle. Stoke Charlotte gives a decent try. The ambiance is totally contemporary, but somehow cozy at the same time. Lots of attention to detail, all the way down to our NC sourced tableware! Huge vaulted ceilings make a challenge for any decorator, but they managed to make it beautiful and warm. Definitely on the VERY LOUD side though. Gorgeous marble is everywhere, but sound has a field day in all that open space. Probably not a first-date-restaurant. Unless you prefer yelling at your table mate.   The food was amazing. We started with a cheese plate, and some meat jelly. Oh wait, I meant Bone Marrow. Very nice. Marrow was cooked perfectly, with sharp stabs of ginger and sweetness. For entrees, we had the Duck Ragu, Lamb Shoulder, and Prime Rib. Server tried to warn us that people share, but we got greedy, and wanted to taste too many things. All were melt in your mouth tasty. The ragu, a flavor explosion. The lamb was a fork tender mouth-gasm, and the steak? Well...I always used to say, I can cook the hell out of a steak on my own, why buy it at twice the cost at a restaurant? But this piece of MEAT did the magic last night. Cooked to exact temp (of course), the chef let the flavor of this meat take center stage wisely. Nicely done.   Our sides were also amazing. Although grits that aren't grits, may piss off your average True Southern foodie. That side should be thoroughly explained to the table when ordered (not everyone will know, or love a 63 egg like I do). That's the only food 'complaint' I have. And I can't truly complain, because I loved 'em! The flavor was subtle, but loverly. The rice/(grits) cooked to creaminess, but not sludgy. The fingerling potatoes came out like big fat wanna'-eat-em-with-my-fingers French fries. Super crispy and salty on the outside. Smushy and hot on the inside.   Alas, we only had room for one dessert, and it has to be the smaller one. The Strawberry Shortcake was pretty spectacular. Once again, the main, fresh, locally sourced strawberries were wisely allowed to be the focus. We'll definitely have to go back to try the mega donut cake specialty though! They even had spectacular coffee!  All-in-all it was a pleasant experience. Only got the 4 stars because there were a couple of front-of-the-house glitches. They did pretty well with our SUPER picky expectations. Couple of erroneous food drops, server forgot to ask the entire table if they wanted bevs (rookie mistake, overall he was wonderful), and if you're gonna' pretend like you're that kind of restaurant, (complete with pretty people and a snotty hostess - which I will always grade lower for as snotty is so unnecessary!), you should know who's food is who's when serving. Not "selling" entrees are only a food-snob's standards though. So not a huge thang.   Well done Stokes!! Will definitely have to try again soon!

WPF8jVv_Pwdqs4hyGTOZDw.text: I went here with my sister and her future sister - in - law. My sister made reservations at 7 but we arrived at 6:45 and was sat right away. They also have free valet parking if dining at Stoke (located inside the Marriott hotel).The hostess made sure to ask if we were okay with a booth; which we all said yes too, the only strange part was she motioned me to go ahead of her. I was aimlessly walking because how am I supposed to know which table you are seating me? The interior was modern rustic. The made sure to incorporate wood pieces but still made it modern in style. The plates were a combination of ceramic plates and wooden boards. It is a lot bigger than it seems to be "just inside a hotel." The attire is casual but many did dress a little nicer. We sat down and were quickly greeted by our waitress Molly. The menu is a little on the small side (fits on one big paper) but the flavors are definitely all there! All of us decided to share so we could try everything since we have never been here before and also to share the cost. From the Share: - Pretzel Brioche: Came with three different butters; I believe the first one had garlic and whole grain beads inside (my favorite of the three). Next, they had a cheerwine butter; you are in the south after all. Lastly, was a honey butter and just as most are; sweet but not too much. Usually pretzel breads/rolls are a little harder but this was so soft and the little bit of saltiness from the pretzel was great. - Mom's Deviled Eggs: Love that they chopped the bread and butter pickles to put on top instead of putting one big piece of it like I have seen other restaurants do. In order for them to lay flat on the plate they have to cut the bottom, this makes it a little thinner so be careful. - Pork Belly: Absolutely delicious. I was worried the watermelon molasses was going to be too sweet but it was just right, not sticky and gross. I would rather not share this item because of the portion size. The bottom was charred and it gave the dish a great crunch and smoky flavor to each bite. - Winter Roots: Plated beautifully and when added to our entrees, went well. It was also a nice palette cleanser if ate alone. Included beets, radishes, caraway, and buttermilk. From the Entree: - Scallops: They had five on the plate but they were not small. The were cooked perfectly. They were placed on top of a ham hock consomme; which was at the right level, not overflowing but enough to taste. - Sticky Pork Shank: We asked what the menu favorite was and this was what was recommended. This did not let us down. Definitely my favorite dish of the night. The meat fell off the bone, was not dry, and the sauce was there but not even needed (but who doesn't love sauces). From the Companions:  - Esquites: This corn salad was delicious but definitely a sharing side dish. - Crispy fingerlings: These potatoes were cooked to have a slight crunch, that usually you don't get, and it was paired with a creamy aioli. My only suggestion - have the aioli come on the side and not the bottom below several fingerlings. - Green Beans: Had a little spice to them, a nice crunch from the pistachios, and the apples added a crunch but a sweet acidity as well. - Broccoli: I personally did not eat this because I do not like broccoli that much but the other two did. They agreed there was a spice to it which is unexpected but it was tasty overall.  From the Dessert Menu: (This is a completely separate menu that you have to ask for) - Apple Pie: We also got a scoop of vanilla ice cream to accompany the pie. It was served warm and came out in a mini cast iron skillet. The crust was too hard and not flaky (we could barely cut it) but the filling was the best part! They topped it with oats instead of a dutch crumble and I personally like the added crunch this gave to the dessert. From the Cocktails: - Espresso Martini: I love coffee/espresso and when you mix it with Kahlua, even better. The glass was unexpectedly small but it tasted great and I hope the pour count was accurate! Overall a great first time experience, will definitely be going back!

iZ5Te1SfTnYuQW1ssEC5Ug.text: Awesome brunch! I got the deep fried stuffed French toast and it was so good! A bit pricey for the amount of food you get, but worth it. Also love the decor! It's inside the Marriott hotel and they'll validate your parking if you get valet.

84mcBPBZQI98S-mb3uZtHg.text: Solid service, food, drinks, decor and dessert. Sit towards the kitchen for a good experience. Definitely get the donut - take home what you don't eat there! Will be back.

6fgOt1c08LAck_XicbkYzg.text: Our family of four had tickets to go see The Lion King at the Belk Theatre and we wanted to grab a quick yummy dinner close by. My husband suggested Stoke because he had eaten lunch there and enjoyed it so we made reservations. When we were seated at our table in front of the open kitchen, our server Destiny introduced herself and let us know what the specials were. As we perused the menu, we decided to get a number of small plates, appetizers and sides instead of four large dinners. We were happy we did! The hush puppies were crunchy on the outside, soft and tasty on the inside very delicious! The pork belly was very tasty along with the octopus and shishito peppers. I'm so glad we ordered the pretzel brioche with the honey butters, it was quite sizable and delicious. To top it all off, we ordered the donut with whip cream, which was as big as my head! That donut was absolutely delicious and the cream I wish I had more of that because it was so good! Food and service were great and we will definitely be back!

kydI76xQsv0XCq0jwLL9yA.text: I'm not a frequent yelp reviewer. However I felt the need to make note of the exceptional experience we had at Stoke tonight. My wife and I chose this spot to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we were not disappointed. We were greeted by a hostess that seated us promptly. Our server Hannah began what would be an evening of constant satisfaction. She was extremely knowledgeable of the drink menu as well as the food menu. She made recommendations that fit our tastes perfectly. The food was prepared perfectly. Our dinner experience was exactly what my wife and I hoped for on such a special night for us. Please don't be turned away because their location is inside the Marriott. The ingredients are all locally sourced, prepared impeccably, and the service is above and beyond. Please stop in and give this spot a try.

1cWf0bhRdzWlX3W7yVdCSw.text: I found this place on Yelp while visiting downtown Charlotte and figured I'd give it a shot for a quick lunch. I had no idea it was in a hotel! It's a cute restaurant with a comfortable, modern atmosphere. However, on a Saturday afternoon I expected there to be more than ONE person working. Our server was also running the bar, and while he was super nice.. he couldn't help but be a bit slow since he had zero help.   The menu is very, very limited.. and a bit pricey (but I'd expect that at a hotel restaurant.) My boyfriend and I each ordered burgers and a soda.. and our bill with tip was over $40. However, the food was fantastic. I love the farm to table concept - everything was fresh and tasty.

ibsnnDAnJqb3vrLtBYwPRw.text: We decided to drop into Stoke in search of a good bourbon cocktail. They didn't disappoint! Placed in the lobby of a Marriott its still a great vibe. The bar itself is beautiful, copper and white counter tops. We were promptly greeted at the bar, and happy to find the bartender was clearly top notch. We watched him make a few for other people and ordered two old fashioneds. I stuck with the original recipe, which had a bit of bite from the Elijah Craig. My boyfriend substituted it for Michters and it was nice and smooth. All around a good experience!

GPkVbHXTZ36ZPOavOAAF7w.text: I was really excited to try this out because of all the hype surrounding it. Limited menu was good but not too many options. Prices were high but comparable to uptown... there are better options out there but a great spot for cocktails and appetizers before a night out if you are uptown.

ynhlgUrZl26442DktgvfKQ.text: This is for the bar area only - extremely cool vibe for the location and nice signature cocktails.

9OmX1wnZd4kjrKW5SNMQcQ.text: This was a very good restaurant and very good experience. The drink menu had a wide variety of hand crafted cocktails, beer and wines to choose from. Both hand crafted cocktails I had were excellent. The bartender was very nice and personable as well. When we got to our table we ordered deviled eggs and were very happy with those. The cobia was delicious and the side of broccoli was seriously amazing. The best broccoli I've ever had. It had a hollandaise and fish egg topping which sounds undesirable but it was amazing. The dessert wasn't as exciting as the dinner. A pound cake with banana and peanut butter. I tasted more like a peanut butter and banana sandwich than how it was explained to be. Overall, I give four stars instead of five because of the dessert. I will definitely go back and try the shank which looked really good too.

gdPLueI03yoIG_jKILS7uQ.text: This place is a must try! They are absolutely amazing! We tried the lamb, trout special and pork. We also tried the deviled eggs, butternut squash and donuts. Everything was 100% perfection. The service was perfect. Very kind staff. They do valet parking so even though they are uptown there is no trouble to come and enjoy. The ambiance was very nice, with an open kitchen. They are great for a party or celebrating a special occasion. Perfect for a small or large groups but seating is limited so if you are bringing a large party, I would make a reservation first. I can not wait to come back. My favorite was the lamb, it was cooked perfectly!

eggh_E9s5Us4dT-tdBd8bg.text: The servers were great. The food was delicious I can't wait to go again. I had the flank steak that was just wonderful. Very flavorful and cooked to perfection. They serve family style sides so no sides come with your meal. So I ordered the side of Carolina grits and that paired well with it.   My friend had the lamb and that was excellent. Again very flavorful and cooked to perfection. We were beyond pleased with our selections.   I don't want to spoil it for you with details because I want you to be as surprised as I was but you MUST have the donut for dessert.  This place is amazing. The went last night and I'm going again today!!

dIFFMYeyr8K9bZPkx-n62g.text: STOKE is a refreshing modern take on the open kitchen concept. Our server, Tony, was warm, welcoming and offered fantastic recommendations. My favorites where 5he smoked octopus appetizer, the beets (ordered as a side), and the lamb shoulder. Come hungry and try EVERYTHING. Leave room for the 1lb donut dessert...it's under real (and perfect to split amongst 5 people).
